reviews.text: I stayed at the Night Hotel for 2 days and would rate it as the best priced boutique hotel I've stayed it. The rooms are sml but super sexy and stylish. The service was great, staff extremely friendly and the hotel was spotlessly clean. Location is also great if you want to be near Times Sqr, Theatres etc and only an US$10 cab ride to Soho.
reviews.title: loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I just returned from 4 nights at the Night hotel in NYC. I had read a lot of the glowing reviews prior to booking and was actually a bit disappointed with the overall experience. Here some general comments:
reviews.title: Good, but Far from Great...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Yes, the rooms are very small (but to be expected in midtown NY), but they are also a bit stifling - ours had a small, curtained window that looked directly across (about 3 ft.) at the dark wall of the building next door. And while I will agree the beds are very comfortable, there is no way that they are the standard length (we had a Queen). I am 5'10 and was too long for the bed. Overall, the rooms have a cool design, but are really dark.
reviews.title: Three Great Nights

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service
reviews.title: Loved loved loved it!

reviews.text: reception on arri was very good, although rooms were smaller than i was used to it was very clean and comfortable,ideal for Time Square (50yards)no noise.

reviews.text: overall i would recommend and give it 4.5.
reviews.title: Not great

reviews.text: Stayed at the hotel for 4 nights. Overall, a really disappointing experience. (both external factors and hotel service issues).
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: Came in on a red-eye flight from LA. Was hoping for an early check-in to freshen up. Due to the size of the hotel, no early check-in was available.
reviews.title: Loved the Night Hotel

likes.liked: — Chic decor, lovely room, helpful stall and great amenities and service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Requested a no-smoking room, and received a smoke-filled room, so we had to request for a room change.
reviews.title: Lacking the Fundamentals

likes.disliked: — The noise of the heating system

reviews.text: My sister and I have just returned from our first visit to the Big Apple. When booking I considered the larger luxury hotels but decided on the Night as it looked funky and the location looked good and I'm so glad that I did. The staff were fantastic, they couldn't do enough for us, from hailing a cab to recommending and booking restuarants for us, one night calling several as it was midnight (thanks Bret, TAO was fantastic!). Our room was great, exactly as they look in the pictures, we had a Queen room which was quite large, more than enough space for the two of us. The complimentary breakfast was lovely, fresh muffins, bagels, toast, cereal etc. and the location was great, just a minutes walk to Times Square.
reviews.title: 3 Fantastic Nights at The Night Hotel

likes.disliked: — There wasn't anything that we didn't like.

reviews.text: All in all we really could not have asked for a better hotel. We would recommend the Night Hotel and would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: not bad !
A great stay for our first visit to NYC
reviews.text: well stayed at "Night" last saturday for one night in new york. firstly great location, 2 minutes from times square so that was gd and walking distance easily to all the shops and central park, rockerfella centre etc...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: bit of a weird hotel! think i liked it ! small rooms with no view, but that is new york all over. very comfy bed and well equipped room, plasma , bose clock radio, even oxygen for sale in mini bar !
reviews.title: Excellent stay

reviews.text: no bath just shower , very black in rooms but then theme of hotel is black and white so to be expected !
reviews.title: Cool boutique hotel in great location

reviews.text: Torn sheets on multiple nights. Room furnishings generally worn down. Indifferent staff. Lots of noise from other guests at all hours of the night.
reviews.title: Completely Tired

likes.disliked: — Noise from other guests throughout the evening.

reviews.title: Great nights at The Night
reviews.text: I was a guest there once a month for a year and witnessed the overall decline of this hotel property.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are lots of other choices near Times Square in the same price range that offer better values.
reviews.title: Pluses and Minuses

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just came home from a fabulous trip to NYC. One of the things that made the trip so great was this hotel. The staff was friendly and helpful, the location could not have been better, and our room was comfortable. In previous reviews there have been comments about the noise of the heating/air conditioning. Yes, it makes noise but it never woke us up. Others have commented on consturction noise. Yes there was some construction noise. It's New York and the hotel hardly has control over what must be rebuilt or repaired in the neighborhood. This hotel is located steps from Time Square and within easy walking distance to Rockefeller Center, Grand Central Station, and Central Park (and we are a middle aged couple who are not in the best shape). We took our young adult children on this trip and they also loved the hotel. We will deffinately stay again!
reviews.title: Boutique heaven

reviews.text: We were put into a TINY room with AN unpleasant smokey stench. We were moved THE NEXT DAY to a larger, nicer room, with a bottle of Chardonney given to us in compensation. The staff was very pleasant and helpful.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Location
